channel.title: TrendNET - TW100-S4W1CAvF Router Port Forwarding
channel.description:
Open a web browser like internet explorer or Netscape. Enter the ip address of your router in the address bar of your browser. In the picture above the address bar has http://www.google.com in it. Just replace all of that with the ip address of your router. By default the ip address should be set to 192.168.1.1.
[img]http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Trendnet/TW100-S4W1CAvF/TW100-S4W1CAvF1.jpg[/img]
Once you're done with that a screen should appear up asking for password. If you have password set type it in to log in. If you haven't put any passwords then just press Log in.
Click the Advanced Setup link near the center of the page.
Click the NAT link near the left of the page. You should now see a new menu. In this new menu, click Virtual Server.
[img]http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Trendnet/TW100-S4W1CAvF/TW100-S4W1CAvF4.jpg[/img]
Enter the ports to forward into the Mapping Ports box. These ports can be entered as a list 23,24,25, a range 500-600, or a combination of both 23,45,500-600. Enter the ip address to forward these ports to into the Server IP box. If you are forwarding ports so you can run a program on your computer, you should enter your computer's ip address into that box. Put a checkmark in the Enabled checkbox.
When you're finished, click Apply near the bottom of the screen to save your changes.
And that's it! You're done!
[b][size=18pt]ALL THE PICTURES ARE TAKEN FROM PORTFORWARD.COM. I HAVE NOT MADE THESE PICTURES.[/size][/b]

item.title: TrendNET - TW100-S4W1CAvF Router Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Zorc Zorc
item.description:
@Zorc wrote:

Open a web browser like internet explorer or Netscape. Enter the ip address of your router in the address bar of your browser. In the picture above the address bar has http://www.google.com in it. Just replace all of that with the ip address of your router. By default the ip address should be set to 192.168.1.1.

Once you’re done with that a screen should appear up asking for password. If you have password set type it in to log in. If you haven’t put any passwords then just press Log in.

Click the Advanced Setup link near the center of the page.

Click the NAT link near the left of the page.
You should now see a new menu. In this new menu, click Virtual Server.

Enter the ports to forward into the Mapping Ports box. These ports can be entered as a list 23,24,25, a range 500-600, or a combination of both 23,45,500-600. Enter the ip address to forward these ports to into the Server IP box. If you are forwarding ports so you can run a program on your computer, you should enter your computer’s ip address into that box. Put a checkmark in the Enabled checkbox.

When you’re finished, click Apply near the bottom of the screen to save your changes.

And that’s it! You’re done!

[size=18pt]ALL THE PICTURES ARE TAKEN FROM PORTFORWARD.COM. I HAVE NOT MADE THESE PICTURES.[/size]

Read full topic
